intro: Mirbelia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered mirbelia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, greyish bark and alternate, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and are followed by small, woody fruits. Mirbelia racemosa is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
